meanings.definition: A protective embankment or wall for a gun emplacement.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers hid behind the sturdy barbette during the battle.
meanings.sent2: The fort's barbette provided cover for the artillery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel peeked out from behind the barbette, playing a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a barbette against the harsh criticisms she faced.
meanings.sent5: The barbette rose like a guardian, shielding the soldiers from enemy fire.

meanings.definition: A platform or mound on a warship for mounting guns.
meanings.sent1: The sailors secured the cannons on the barbette of the warship.
meanings.sent2: The captain directed the crew to aim the guns from the barbette.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the barbette, enjoying the view of the vast ocean.
meanings.sent4: The barbette stood tall, ready to unleash its firepower at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The barbette rumbled as the cannons were loaded, signaling the start of battle.

meanings.definition: A type of turret on a warship.
meanings.sent1: The barbette rotated smoothly, adjusting the aim of the cannons.
meanings.sent2: The crew members maintained the barbette to ensure its functionality.
meanings.sent3: The playful dolphin swam circles around the barbette, curious about its purpose.
meanings.sent4: The barbette loomed over the deck like a silent guardian of the seas.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the barbette impressed all who beheld its craftsmanship.
